repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Enterprise
            Rehabilitation and Development Project (ERDP)

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is adjudged
            unsatisfactory. The significant delay in start-up reflected
            the underlying problems which beset the project. Despite
            remedial efforts the project failed, even partially, to meet
            its objective. None of the project components has sustained
            its activities. Fundamental weaknesses in design and
            preparation stemmed from ignoring the risk of
            socio-political instability; ignoring the views of
            commercial banks; failing to reach an agreement with the
            Bank of Central African States; delaying project start-up;
            and slowly responding to the Borrower's perceived
            inertia. Consequently, World Bank performance was
            unsatisfactory. The considerable efforts made during
            supervision to place the project on track were thwarted by
            mutinies and do not alter this conclusion. Borrower
            ownership and commitment to the project were weak throughout
            the project. Furthermore, the complex nature of the project
            demanded a high level of determination and coordination that
            was not forthcoming. Therefore, Borrower performance was
            rated as highly unsatisfactory. This type of project should
            not be launched when there is uncertainty about the
            necessary conditions for investment and business. Critical
            stakeholders--the government ministries, banks, business
            associations, leading entrepreneurs--should be involved in
            designing and setting up well thought through project
            implementation arrangements. When a project repeatedly
            performs unsatisfactorily, the Bank should act sooner to
            cancel i

18156178.theme: Gender,Other financial and private sector development,Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise support
18156178.majtheme: Social dev/gender/inclusion,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Enterprise
            Rehabilitation and Development (ERDP) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the project
            is to promote and finance private enterprises in the
            productive sectors in support of the ongoing structural
            adjustment process and financial sector reform program.  The
            project would include the following components : a) an apex
            line of credit within the commercial banking system to
            finance fixed assets and working capital needs of eligible
            existing and new enterprises; b) a micro-enterprise (ME)
            development program managed by Volunteers in Technical
            Assistance (VITA), a US based non-governmental organization
            (NGO); c) technical assistance for project management and
            strengthening of private sector promotion agencies; d) a
            training program for enterprise management and project
            evaluation; and e) a studies program to carry out
            sub-project feasibility, preparation and sector studies
            relevant to enterprise development.
